LONDON( Reuters)- Google Inc wants to avoid a lengthy legal battle with European Union regulators investigating its market dominance, the Sunday Telegraph quoted its chief executive as saying. We certainly want to avoid that, Eric Schmidt told the paper in an interview.`` I think it is in our interests and I would hope in their interests to a do a quick analysis of concerns that have been raised by competitors, hopefully they

this material.'' Police said the inquiry was being moved from the Metropolitan Police's counter- href="http://uk.news.yahoo.com/fc/terror-attacks.html"> terrorism command and would now be led by a specialist crime unit. This work will be carried out by the specialist crime directorate which has been investigating a related phone hacking allegation since September 2010, said the police. The News of the World's royal correspondent Clive Goodman was jailed in 2007 for conspiracy to access mobile phone messages involving Princes William and Harry.
